CONFIDENTIALITY AGREEMENT.html:
CONFIDENTIALITY AGREEMENT

This Confidentiality Agreement (the "Agreement") is made on {{person_1.current_date}}.

By and between:

Party 1 Party 2
Name: {{person_1.full_name.first_name}} {{person_1.full_name.last_name}}
Address: {{person_1.address.street}}, {{person_1.address.city}}, {{person_1.address.state}} {{person_1.address.zip}}, {{person_1.country}} 		Name: {{person_2.full_name.first_name}} {{person_2.full_name.last_name}}
Address: {{person_2.address.street}}, {{person_2.address.city}}, {{person_2.address.state}} {{person_2.address.zip}}, {{person_2.country}}

I. Recitals

WHEREAS, the Parties of this Agreement executed a contract named {{person_1.contract_name}} on {{person_1.date}}, and they wish to set forth the terms and conditions of their non-disclosure commitments via a separate agreement.

Under this Agreement, the parties are referred to individually as "Disclosing Party" or "Receiving Party," depending on their role in disclosing or receiving confidential information.

II. Confidential Information

"Confidential Information" refers to all proprietary, non-public, or sensitive information shared between the parties during the course of their commercial relationship. This includes, but is not limited to, business strategies, financial data, technical processes, software, designs, research, and any other materials or knowledge that may give one party a competitive advantage. Confidential Information also includes information received from third parties under confidentiality obligations. Information that is publicly available, obtained through legal means independent of this agreement, or required to be disclosed by law or a court order, is not considered Confidential Information.

III. Protection of Confidential Information

Both parties agree to exercise the utmost care in safeguarding Confidential Information and to take all reasonable measures to prevent unauthorized access, use, or disclosure. The Confidential Information should be protected with at least the same level of security and caution as each party applies to its own proprietary information, but no less than a reasonable standard of care. Any disclosure of Confidential Information to employees, agents, consultants, or subcontractors will only be permitted when absolutely necessary for the performance of the agreement, and such individuals must be bound by confidentiality obligations equivalent to those in this Agreement. Both parties will be held responsible for ensuring that these individuals adhere to the terms of this Agreement.

IV. Violation of this Agreement

In the event of a violation or breach of this Agreement, the party aware of the breach must promptly notify the other party in writing. The notice must include details regarding the nature and extent of the breach. The affected party reserves the right to pursue any and all legal remedies available, including but not limited to seeking injunctive relief, specific performance, or damages for any losses incurred as a result of the breach. The breaching party shall be liable for any direct or indirect harm caused by the unauthorized disclosure or misuse of Confidential Information.

V. Return of Materials Containing Confidential Information

Upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement or the commercial relationship, each party is obligated to return all materials, documents, files, or any other items containing Confidential Information, whether in physical or electronic form. The return of materials must occur within a reasonable timeframe, or if requested, such materials must be destroyed, with proof of destruction provided to the other party. This obligation to return or destroy materials containing Confidential Information applies even after the end of the relationship or the termination of this Agreement, ensuring that no party retains access to sensitive information without authorization.

VI. Disclosure of Confidential Information

Disclosure of Confidential Information to any third party, or the use of such information for any purpose not expressly authorized by this Agreement, is strictly prohibited. No party shall disclose any part of the Confidential Information to any individual, entity, or organization without obtaining prior written consent from the other party, except when required by law or governmental order. In such cases, the disclosing party must promptly notify the other party to allow them the opportunity to seek protective measures or legal relief before any disclosure is made. Unauthorized disclosure or use of Confidential Information will result in immediate legal action and potential compensation for damages.

VII. Term and Assignment

This Agreement shall remain in effect until terminated by mutual written consent of both parties. The confidentiality obligations outlined herein shall continue indefinitely, even after the termination of the Agreement, the cessation of the business relationship, or the return of all Confidential Information. Neither party shall assign, transfer, or otherwise delegate any rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other party. Any unauthorized assignment or transfer will be considered a material breach of this Agreement.

VIII. Partial Invalidity

In the event that any provision of this Agreement is found to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable by a court or competent authority, the remaining provisions shall continue to be valid and enforceable to the fullest extent permitted by law. The invalid or unenforceable provision will be replaced with a valid provision that most closely reflects the original intent of the parties, while maintaining the balance of rights and obligations under the Agreement.

IX. Amendment

Any amendments or modifications to this Agreement must be made in writing and signed by authorized representatives of both parties. No oral agreements or understandings will be considered binding unless confirmed in writing. The written amendment will become part of this Agreement and will supersede any previous provisions that are inconsistent with the new terms.

X. Notifications

All notifications under this Agreement must be made in writing and delivered either in person, by courier, by registered mail, or via email with read receipt confirmation. Each party shall provide the other with their current contact information, including physical and email addresses, for the purpose of receiving notifications. Notifications are deemed effective on the date of delivery, provided they are sent to the appropriate address as specified in this Agreement.

XI. Governing Law

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of {{person_1.jurisdiction}}, without regard to its conflict of law principles. In the event of any dispute arising from or related to this Agreement, the parties agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts in {{person_1.jurisdiction}} for the resolution of such disputes. Any proceedings related to this Agreement shall be conducted in the {{person_1.jurisdiction}} courts, and the prevailing party shall be entitled to recover all legal costs, including attorney fees, incurred in connection with the dispute.

**signature_1**/

Signature of Party 1

**signature_2**/

Signature of Party 2

{{person_1.full_name.first_name}} {{person_1.full_name.last_name}}

{{person_2.full_name.first_name}} {{person_2.full_name.last_name}}
CONSULTING AGREEMENT.html:
CONSULTING AGREEMENT

This Consulting Agreement (the "Agreement") is entered into by and between the parties below on {{contract.current_date}}.

{{consultant.company_name}}, a registered company located at {{consultant.address.street}}, {{consultant.address.city}}, {{consultant.address.state}}, {{consultant.address.zip}}, (hereby referred to as the "Consultant"), and:

{{client.full_name.first_name}} {{client.full_name.last_name}}, whose address is at {{client.address.street}}, {{client.address.city}}, {{client.address.state}}, {{client.address.zip}} (hereby referred to as the "Client").

WHEREAS, the Client desires to obtain the services of the Company as detailed below:

  • {{consultant.services[0]}}
  • {{consultant.services[1]}}
  • {{consultant.services[2]}}

NOW THEREFORE, for and in consideration of the mutual covenants made by the parties hereto, the Parties to this agreement agree to the terms and conditions below:

Terms and Conditions

1. Scope of the Agreement:

This Agreement outlines the provision of services by the Consultant to the Client as described above, in exchange for a specified fee. The consultancy services are strictly confined to the matters detailed herein. Any modifications to the scope of this Agreement, whether expansion or limitation, shall require mutual written consent from both parties.

2. Principles of Consultancy:
  • The Consultant shall not claim any commercial rights over works created within the scope of the consulting service, nor use the developed products elsewhere for personal benefit.
  • The Consultant shall operate based on information provided by the Client and shall not be held responsible for any adverse outcomes, losses, or damages caused by incomplete or incorrect information provided by the Client.
  • The Consultant shall present ideas and suggestions to the Client in writing, relying on their expertise and knowledge.
  • The Client retains full discretion to adhere to, partially implement, or disregard the information and ideas provided by the Consultant, and assumes all responsibility for such actions in the post-delivery process.
  • The Consultant shall strive to fulfill the obligations of this Agreement to the best of their ability. However, if the Client deems the service inadequate or unsatisfactory, the Consultant agrees not to seek any material or moral compensation, except for termination of the Agreement.
  • Neither party shall transfer the rights or obligations established under this Agreement to any third-party individuals or entities.

3. Financial Provisions:

  • The total service fee to be paid under this Agreement is {{terms.amount}}, payable every {{terms.time_period}} of the month.
  • Payments shall be made via {{terms.payment_method}}.
  • If the Client fails to pay within five (5) days after the due date, late charges of {{terms.late_fee}} shall be applied.

4. Term:

  • This Agreement becomes effective on {{contract.start_date}} and remains in force for {{terms.duration}}.
  • At the end of this period, the parties may decide to:
    • Extend the term of this Agreement under the same conditions in writing, or
    • Sign a new Agreement if the Client wishes to continue receiving consultancy services.

5. Termination:

  • The contract will expire automatically after 30 days unless otherwise agreed by the parties.
  • If the Client wishes to terminate this Agreement, a written notice of 30 days must be submitted to the Consultant.
    • All debts not yet due under the Agreement shall become immediately payable to the Consultant.
  • If any law or regulation renders the obligations of either party non-executable, the Agreement shall automatically terminate on the date of such occurrence.
    • The Consultant will not be entitled to any receivables after the termination date and cannot claim compensation.
  • If the Client fails to pay the fees under this Agreement within 15 days, the Consultant reserves the right to:
    • Suspend its obligations under this Agreement, and
    • Immediately terminate the Agreement.

6. Intellectual Property:

  • All proprietary rights to work products resulting from the Consulting Services, including but not limited to copyrights and patents, shall belong to the Client.
  • The Consultant agrees not to claim ownership of any intangible property created through the services provided to the Client, either before or after the completion and delivery of such work.

7. Confidentiality:

  • The Consultant agrees to maintain the confidentiality of all information disclosed under this Agreement ("Confidential Information").
  • The Consultant shall not disclose or transmit any Confidential Information to third parties without the written consent of the Client, except where:
    • Mandatory notification to statutory bodies or governmental authorities is required by law.
  • The Consultant shall prevent the unauthorized dissemination of Confidential Information.
  • The confidentiality obligations outlined in this section shall survive the termination of this Agreement for any reason.

8. Prohibition on Competition:

The Consultant acknowledges that the information provided by the Client represents unique and valuable assets. As such, the Consultant agrees that for a period of {{terms.duration}} years following the termination of this Agreement—whether voluntary or involuntary—they shall not engage directly or indirectly in any business competitive with the Client's. This restriction applies to the geographical area of {{consultant.geographical_area}}. Competitive activities include, but are not limited to, acting as an owner, partner, or agent in such businesses, becoming an employee of a competitor, or soliciting the Client’s customers for the benefit of a third party. In the event of a breach of this non-competition clause, the Client will issue a written notice requesting immediate compliance. If the Consultant fails to comply within thirty (30) days, they shall pay a penalty of {{terms.penalty}}. This penalty does not absolve the Consultant from their obligation to adhere to this clause.

9. Miscellaneous:

Amendments: Any amendments to this Agreement shall only be valid if made in writing and signed by both Parties. Severability: If any provision of this Agreement is deemed invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain valid and enforceable. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution: This Agreement is governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of {{terms.jurisdiction}}. Any disputes related to this Agreement, including questions of validity or termination, shall be resolved by the courts and execution offices of {{terms.jurisdiction}}. Notifications: All notifications under this Agreement must be in writing and delivered to the addresses specified herein. If a party’s address changes and the other party is not informed, notifications sent to the previously indicated address will be deemed legally valid. Entire Agreement: This Agreement represents the entire understanding between the Parties, superseding any prior written or oral agreements related to its subject matter.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, each of the Parties has executed this Consulting Agreement; both Parties by its duly authorized officer, as of the day and year set forth below.

Consultant


Name: {{consultant.full_name.first_name}} {{consultant.full_name.last_name}}


Date: {{contract.current_date}}


Signature: **signature_1**/

Client


Name: {{client.full_name.first_name}} {{client.full_name.last_name}}


Date: {{contract.current_date}}


Signature: **signature_2**/

End of Agreement
Copyright Assignment Agreement.html:
Copyright Assignment Agreement

I. Contracting Parties

This Assignment of Copyright Agreement (hereinafter designated as the "Agreement") is entered into between the following parties:

{{transferor.name}} {{transferee.name}}
{{transferor.address.street}}
{{transferor.address.street_line_2}}
{{transferor.address.city}}, {{transferor.address.state}} {{transferor.address.postal}}
{{transferor.address.country}}
Phone: {{transferor.phone}}
Email: {{transferor.email}} 		{{transferee.address.street}}
{{transferee.address.street_line_2}}
{{transferee.address.city}}, {{transferee.address.state}} {{transferee.address.postal}}
{{transferee.address.country}}
Phone: {{transferee.phone}}
Email: {{transferee.email}}

WHEREAS the Assignor has created and currently holds ownership of {{work.description}} (hereinafter referred to as the "Work") detailed below;

{{work.description}}

WHEREAS the Assignee seeks to acquire ownership of the Work's copyright for commercial exploitation and distribution purposes, and the Assignor consents to transfer these rights under the terms and conditions outlined in this document;

NOW, THEREFORE, in light of the mutual promises contained herein, both parties hereby agree to the following:

II. Copyright Assignment

The Assignor hereby permanently transfers and conveys to the Assignee complete ownership, title, and interest in the Work's copyright, encompassing all rights granted under copyright law and any related intellectual property rights associated with the Work.

This assignment encompasses, without limitation, the exclusive rights to reproduce, distribute, exhibit publicly, and develop derivative works based on the Work. However, this transfer explicitly excludes any right to alter the Work and shall not be interpreted to grant such authority.

III. Duration and Cessation

This Agreement shall commence on {{contract.current_date}}, and the rights granted herein may only be exercised during the specified term in accordance with this Agreement's provisions.

The Agreement's duration will not automatically extend beyond its expiration date unless a new agreement is executed prior to termination.

Prior to the conclusion of the fixed term, this Agreement may be dissolved through mutual written consent of both the Assignor and Assignee.

Should either party fail to fulfill a fundamental obligation under this Agreement, the other party may terminate by providing written notification. The party in breach shall have thirty (30) days following receipt of such notice to remedy the violation. Failure to cure within this timeframe shall result in immediate termination.

Upon Agreement termination, the Assignee must discontinue all usage of the transferred copyright, and all rights and interests in the Work shall revert to the Assignor.

IV. Declarations and Guarantees

The Assignor affirms and guarantees their status as the exclusive creator and rightful owner of the Work, possessing full authority to transfer the associated copyright. The Assignor certifies that the Work constitutes original material and does not violate any third party's intellectual property rights.

Any claims or demands for compensation submitted to the Assignee alleging intellectual property or moral rights infringement shall be directed to and handled by the Assignor.

V. Financial Compensation

As consideration for this copyright transfer, the Assignee shall remit to the Assignor a sum to be agreed upon within thirty (30) days of this Agreement's effective date.

Furthermore, the Assignor shall receive an agreed percentage of revenue generated through sales. All payments specified in this Agreement shall be processed via wire transfer.

VI. Miscellaneous

Entire Agreement - This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the parties and supersedes all prior agreements, oral or written, between the parties.

Notifications - Any notice, request, demand, or other communication required or permitted by this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed given when delivered personally, or by email, or mailed by certified or registered mail (postage prepaid, return receipt requested) to the addresses indicated in the first page of this Agreement.

Governing Law - This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the applicable federal law and the laws of the State of {{contract.governing_law}}. Any legal action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be brought in the courts located in {{contract.jurisdiction}}.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Copyright Assignment Agreement as of {{contract.execution_date}}.

{{transferor.name}} {{transferee.name}}

Name: {{transferor.signature.name}}

Date: {{transferor.signature.date}}

Signature:

**signature_1**/

Name: {{transferee.signature.name}}

Date: {{transferee.signature.date}}

Signature:

**signature_2**/

Agreement Conclusion
Independent Contractor Agreement.html:
Independent Contractor Agreement

This Independent Contractor Agreement (referred to herein as the "Agreement") is made and entered into on this {{contract.date.day}} day of {{contract.date.month}}, {{contract.date.year}}, between the following parties:

Contractor

{{contractor.name}}

{{contractor.address.street}}

{{contractor.address.street_line_2}}

{{contractor.address.city}}, {{contractor.address.state}} {{contractor.address.postal}}

Phone: {{contractor.phone}}

Email: {{contractor.email}}

Client

{{client.name}}

{{client.address.street}}

{{client.address.street_line_2}}

{{client.address.city}}, {{client.address.state}} {{client.address.postal}}

Phone: {{client.phone}}

Email: {{client.email}}

WHEREAS, {{client.name}} requires the services of an independent contractor to {{subject}};

WHEREAS, Client acknowledges that Contractor possesses the requisite skills, experience, and qualifications necessary to perform the services outlined in this Agreement;

WHEREAS, Contractor agrees to undertake and fulfill the responsibilities in delivering the specified services;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises, covenants, and conditions set forth herein, Client and Contractor (individually referred to as "Party" and collectively as "Parties") hereby agree as follows:

I. Scope of Work

The specific services to be performed by the Contractor are detailed as follows:

{{scope_of_work}}

II. Term of the Agreement

This Agreement shall be in effect for {{term.duration}}, beginning on {{term.start_date}} and concluding on {{term.end_date}}, subject to early termination as provided herein.

III. Contract Amount

The total compensation for services rendered under this Agreement shall be {{payment.total_amount}}.

Payment shall be disbursed to the Contractor according to the following schedule:

Payment Phase Due Date Amount
Initial Payment {{payment.schedule.initial_payment.date}} {{payment.schedule.initial_payment.amount}}
First Payment {{payment.schedule.first_payment.date}} {{payment.schedule.first_payment.amount}}
Second Payment {{payment.schedule.second_payment.date}} {{payment.schedule.second_payment.amount}}
Final Payment {{payment.schedule.final_payment.date}} {{payment.schedule.final_payment.amount}}

Should any payment become overdue, Client shall be liable for interest at a rate of {{payment.late_payment_interest}}% per annum on the outstanding amount.

IV. Termination

This Agreement may be terminated by either Party, with or without cause, upon providing {{termination.notice_period_days}} days advance written notice to the other Party. Upon termination, Client shall compensate Contractor for all services rendered through the effective date of termination.

V. Intellectual Property

Intellectual Property refers to any intangible creations of the mind, such as artistic or literary works, designs, images, names (including trade names), trademarks, logos, symbols, patents, copyrights, designs, architecture, concepts, and other items used in commerce. As outlined in this Agreement, the Client's use of the Intellectual Property will not be restricted in any way. Any Intellectual Property acquired by the Contractor during the term of this Agreement shall only be used for the purposes of fulfilling this Agreement. In the event that an intellectual creation is developed by the Contractor during the term of this Agreement, the Parties agree that the intellectual property rights for such creations shall belong to the Client, specifically for the purposes of this Agreement.

VI. No Employer-Employee Relationship

The Parties acknowledge that this Agreement does not create an employer-employee relationship. Both Parties are independent contractors, and this Agreement does not form a partnership or joint venture but is solely a contract for service. The Client is not responsible for paying or contributing to the Contractor's social security, taxes, unemployment, workers' compensation, insurance premiums, or any other benefits provided to the Client’s employees.

VII. Return of Client's Property

In the event that this Agreement is terminated or upon the Client's request, the Contractor agrees to return any and all property owned by the Client. Any digital or electronic data may be deleted upon the Client’s request, or physical records may be destroyed at the Client's request if returning such documents or data containing confidential information is not possible.

VIII. Indemnification

Subject to any breach provisions herein, each Party agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party, including its agents, affiliates, officers, and employees, from and against any claims, losses, damages, penalties, liabilities, and expenses of any nature arising from or in connection with any acts or omissions in the performance of this Agreement. Such indemnification obligation shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

IX. Amendments

Any modifications, amendments, or alterations to this Agreement shall have no force or effect unless made in writing and executed by both Parties. Oral amendments or modifications shall have no binding effect.

X. Time of Essence

Time is of the essence in the performance of all duties and obligations under this Agreement. All deadlines and schedules established herein shall be strictly adhered to, and no extensions shall be granted without proper justification and mutual written consent of both Parties.

XI. Assignment

The Contractor shall not assign, delegate, subcontract, or transfer any duties, rights, or responsibilities outlined in this Agreement to any third party without first obtaining express written consent from the Client. Any unauthorized assignment shall be void and constitute a material breach of this Agreement.

XII. Severability

Should any provision of this Agreement be deemed invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, such invalidity shall be limited to the specific provision in question, and all other provisions shall remain in full force and effect. The invalid provision shall be modified or reformed to the extent necessary to make it valid and enforceable while preserving its intent.

XIII. Non-Waiver

The failure of either Party to enforce strict compliance with any provision of this Agreement shall not constitute a waiver of that Party's right to subsequently enforce such provision or any other provision. No waiver of any term, condition, or obligation of this Agreement shall be valid unless made in writing and signed by the waiving Party.

XIV. Entire Agreement

This Agreement constitutes the complete and exclusive statement of understanding between the Parties, superseding all prior or contemporaneous proposals, communications, and agreements, whether oral or written, relating to the subject matter hereof. No representations, understandings, agreements, warranties, or conditions shall affect or modify the terms herein unless expressly stated in this Agreement.

XV. Governing Law

This Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the federal laws and the laws of the State of {{contract.governing_law}}.

Contractor

Name: {{contractor.name}}

Date: {{contractor.signature_date}}



Signature: **signature_1**/

Client

Name: {{client.name}}

Date: {{client.signature_date}}



Signature: **signature_2**/
Intellectual Property Agreement Template:
Intellectual Property Agreement

I. Parties

This Intellectual Property Agreement (the "Agreement") has been signed by and between the parties below, for the purpose of regulating the rules regarding intellectual property rights between the Parties;

The Company The Owner
Company Name: {{company.name}}
Street Address: {{company.streetAddress}}
Street Address Line 2: {{company.streetAddressLine2}}
City: {{company.city}}
State: {{company.state}}
Postal Code: {{company.postalCode}}
Country: {{company.country}}
Phone Number: {{company.phoneNumber}}
Email: {{company.email}}
First Name: {{owner.firstName}}
Last Name: {{owner.lastName}}
Street Address: {{owner.streetAddress}}
Street Address Line 2: {{owner.streetAddressLine2}}
City: {{owner.city}}
State: {{owner.state}}
Postal Code: {{owner.postalCode}}
Country: {{owner.country}}
Phone Number: {{owner.phoneNumber}}
Email: {{owner.email}}

The Company and the Owner shall be individually referred to as "Party" and collectively referred to as the "Parties".

WHEREAS, the Owner is the employee of the Company in the position of {{position}};

WHEREAS, the Owner agrees and undertakes to transfer intellectual property rights and related interests of its original work, designs and other work created during the Owner's employment to the Company under the term and conditions of this Agreement;

NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants contained herein, the Parties agree as follows;

II. Subject and Scope of the Agreement

This Agreement governs the determination of all patent and utility model applications pertaining to inventions and materials that may be subject to intellectual property rights, which arise within the scope of the {{projectName}} Project. This project has been developed by the Owner, and this Agreement establishes the rights and obligations of all parties regarding the industrial application and commercialization of the invention.

Any services that may be provided by the Owner to future transferees or licensees following the transfer or licensing of the subject matter, including services related to patents or utility models connected to the invention, are explicitly excluded from this Agreement's scope. Any fees associated with such services are also considered outside the scope of this Agreement.

III. Rights and Obligations of the Parties

The Owner's Obligations:

1. Shall provide the Company with comprehensive documentation, including all technical specifications and information regarding the developed invention, whether patentable or not, in their capacity as the "inventor" as defined by relevant legislation.

2. Acknowledges and agrees that the Company will be the applicant for all domestic and international registration applications.

3. Commits to providing essential technical information for patent application preparation, including claims, figures, and summaries. The Owner will collaborate with designated personnel and assist in document preparation as needed.

4. Shall maintain confidentiality regarding the invention and will not disclose information to third parties without the Company's written consent. The Owner will refrain from any actions that could compromise the parties' rights under this Agreement.

5. Agrees to participate in necessary marketing negotiations when the Company pursues transfers or licenses.

The Company's Obligations:

1. Shall maintain confidentiality regarding the invention and will not disclose information to third parties without the Owner's written consent. The Company will refrain from any actions that could compromise the parties' rights under this Agreement.

2. Will manage all legal procedures to protect the Owner's rights, including signing necessary documentation for patent/utility model applications and commercialization stages, and will keep the Owner informed of relevant developments.

IV. General Provisions

Commercial decisions regarding patent commercialization require written consent from both Parties. If either Party suspects a violation of patent/utility model rights by third parties, they must promptly notify the other Party. The Company will take necessary legal measures at its expense.

In cases of third-party rights infringement during patent use, licensing, or commercialization, liability is shared jointly between the parties.

V. Term of Agreement

This Agreement shall remain effective throughout the duration of the patent protection period unless terminated according to the Agreement's termination provisions.

VI. Termination

The Parties may terminate this Agreement at any time through mutual written consent and agreement on termination consequences.

If either Party fails to meet their obligations and does not remedy the situation within the specified notice period, or if irreparable damage occurs, the affected Party may terminate this Agreement bilaterally.

VII. Revenue Sharing

Net income from transfers and licenses, after deducting duties, taxes, and fees, shall be distributed as follows:

The Owner - {{owner.revenueShare}}%
The Company - {{company.revenueShare}}%

VIII. Entire Agreement

This Agreement represents the complete understanding between the Parties regarding the subject matter and supersedes all prior agreements, negotiations, and representations, whether written or oral.

IX. Non-Waiver

Failure to enforce any provision does not constitute a waiver of future rights to enforce any terms or conditions of this Agreement.

X. Assignment

Neither Party may assign or transfer this Agreement or its rights and obligations without prior written consent from the other Party, except for the Owner's intellectual property-related rights and obligations.

XI. Notices

All required communications must be in writing and delivered to the addresses specified on the first page or to subsequently designated addresses.

XII. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution

This Agreement is governed by the laws of the State of {{governingState}}. Disputes shall be resolved through arbitration under the rules of {{arbitrationBody}} in {{arbitrationLocation}}. Arbitrator decisions shall be final and binding.

The Company

Date
{{company.date}}
Signature

The Owner
Name
{{owner.firstName}} {{owner.lastName}}

{{owner.date}}

Licensing Agreement.html:
Licensing Agreement

This License Agreement (hereinafter referred to as "Agreement" or "License Agreement") is made effective on {{agreement.executionDate}}, by and between:

{{licensor.companyName}}, a corporation established under the laws of the state of Louisiana, with its principal address at {{licensor.streetAddress}}, {{licensor.city}}, {{licensor.state}}, {{licensor.postalCode}} (hereinafter known as "Licensor");

- and -

{{licensee.companyName}}, a {{licensee.typeOfCompany}} established under the laws of the state of {{licensee.state}}, with principal address at {{licensee.streetAddress}}, {{licensee.city}}, {{licensee.state}}, {{licensee.postalCode}}, {{licensee.country}} (hereinafter known as "Licensee");

WHEREAS, the Licensor is the possessor and owner of Copyright of {{software.copyrightProduct}} (hereinafter known as "Software");

WHEREAS, the Licensor opens for commercialization a non-exclusive license to use the {{software.copyrightProduct}};

WHEREAS, Licensee commits itself to the terms and conditions for the use of such license granted by Licensor;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing premises, the parties hereby agree as follows:

Definitions

The terms and definitions of this Agreement may be regarded with or without the use of capitalization of the letter(s), and whether singular or plural, shall be regarded as the same for the following:

End-User License shall mean a non-exclusive and non-transferrable authorization granted by the Licensor to the Licensee whether as an end-user;
Licensed Product shall mean an application, tool, program, or service that is used by the Licensee as authorized by the Licensor;
Software shall refer to the copyrighted application or program executing specific tasks on a computer under the name {{software.copyrightProduct}};
Term shall refer to the period and termination of the license in this Agreement.
Consideration

In consideration of the grant of license to Licensee for the use of the Software, it is agreed upon that Licensee on every transaction utilizing the Software shall apportion the rate of {{agreement.rateTransactionInNumbers}} ({{agreement.rateTransactionInWords}}).

Ownership and License Grants

The Parties acknowledge that retention over the ownership, title, and interest over the copyright of the Software shall be with Licensor. Subject to the terms and conditions herein, Licensor grants to Licensee the non-exclusive right to use the Software. Licensee may not sell, reproduce, or modify the license granted unto them, except for End-User license where Licensee may distribute licenses granted unto them.

Representation

Licensor represents and warrants to Licensee that upon execution of this Agreement, the Licensor has the full capacity to authorize and license the Software as described above.

Reports

Licensee acknowledges that all transactions processed by the software are logged in a database. Reports of transactions shall be sent by Licensee to Licensor monthly, no later than the last day of each month.

Compliance

Licensee shall, at all times, make reasonable efforts for the use of the Software as permitted in this Agreement. Any changes or intentions by Licensee for other purposes outside the terms of this Agreement shall require consent and approval of Licensor.

Disclaimer

The Software is provided "as is". Licensor shall not be held liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising out of the use of the Software. Licensor is not under obligation to provide support, enhancements, or updates to Licensee.

Warranties

Licensee warrants that they will comply in all respects with the terms and conditions of this Agreement as well as compliance with local, state, and international laws. Licensee bears sole responsibility for any violation constituting any act with the use of the Software and in no case shall such violation be attributable to Licensor. Nothing in this Agreement shall be deemed as a warranty by Licensee in the grant of use of the Software.

Indemnification

The Parties shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless, Licensor, its partners, directors, officers, trustees, agents, successors, and employees from any claims, damages, liabilities, losses, costs, and expenses, including reasonable attorney's fees and cost of suit arising from any failure of any party in any of the warranties in this Agreement.

Term

The term of this Agreement shall commence on the date this Agreement is made effective and shall continue for a period of {{agreement.termDuration}} ({{agreement.termDurationInNumbers}}) {{agreement.termType}}.

Termination

Parties may terminate this agreement with or without cause by submitting a written notice to the other Party, 30 days prior to the effective date of termination. Any pending obligations between the parties shall not extinguish the termination of this Agreement.

Miscellaneous Provisions
Relativity

This Agreement inures to the benefit of, and is binding upon, the parties and their respective legal representatives, successors, and permitted assigns.

Non-waiver

The failure of either party to insist upon the strict compliance with and performance of any of the terms, conditions and covenants hereof shall not be deemed as a relinquishment or waiver of any right that said party may have nor shall it be construed as a waiver of any subsequent breach or default of the terms, conditions, and covenants herein contained, but the same shall continue to be in full force and effect. No waiver by either party shall be deemed to have been made unless expressed in writing and signed by the waiving party.

Counterparts

This contract may be executed in two or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same contract.

Agreement Modification

No modification or alteration of this Contract shall be considered made unless executed in writing and duly signed by the parties hereto.

Governing Law and Dispute Resolution

In the event of any dispute, claim, damage, or controversy arising out of this Agreement, the Parties acknowledge that this Agreement is governed exclusively by the laws of the State of {{agreement.governingState}}. The dispute shall be resolved within sixty (60) days and shall be submitted for arbitration proceedings, with the arbitrator elected by both parties. The cost of the proceedings shall be equally shared by the Parties. However, the prevailing party shall be indemnified by the losing party in terms of the disputed award and attorney's fees, paid by the losing party.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties executed this Agreement as of the date first written above.

**signature_1**/
Licensor Representative Signature
**signature_2**/
Licensee Representative Signature
Non Disclosure Agreement Template.html:
Non Disclosure Agreement

This Non-Disclosure and Confidentiality Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into by and between {{disclosingPartyName}}, referred to hereafter as the "Disclosing Party," whose address is located at

{{disclosingPartyStreet}}, {{disclosingPartyCity}}, {{disclosingPartyState}}, {{disclosingPartyPostal}}, {{disclosingPartyCountry}}.

and {{receivingPartyName}}, hereinafter known as the "Receiving Party," located at

{{receivingPartyStreet}}, {{receivingPartyCity}}, {{receivingPartyState}}, {{receivingPartyPostal}}, {{receivingPartyCountry}}.

and collectively referred to as the "Parties".

WHEREAS, the Parties desire to outline the terms and conditions of their non-disclosure obligations through this Agreement;

WHEREAS, the "Disclosing Party" refers to the party that provides Information, directly or indirectly, to the Receiving Party under or in preparation for this Agreement;

WHEREAS, the "Receiving Party" refers to the party that obtains Information, directly or indirectly, from the Disclosing Party;

NOW, THEREFORE, in acknowledgment of the mutual promises and commitments within this agreement, the Parties agree to the following terms:

I. Definition.

The information under this Agreement, identified or deemed Confidential by the Disclosing Party, regardless of whether it is shared before or after the date of this Agreement, shall include, but is not limited to, the following:

Any and all information of either Party that is disclosed, furnished, or communicated, whether technical, business, or otherwise (including, but not limited to, trade secrets, know-how, and information related to discoveries, instructions, ideas, inventions, concepts, software, equipment, designs, drawings, specifications, techniques, processes, systems, models, data, source code, object code, documentation, diagrams, flow charts, research, development, business plans or opportunities, business strategies, marketing plans or opportunities, future products or opportunities, products or opportunities under consideration, procedures, and any information related to finances, costs, prices, suppliers, vendors, customers, and employees) which are disclosed by either Party or on its behalf, whether before, on, or after the date of this Agreement, regardless of form (whether in writing, machine-readable form, text, drawings, photographs, graphics, designs, plans, or any other form and marked by an appropriate stamp or legend as Confidential, or if disclosed orally, identified as confidential at the time of disclosure or implied by the context and subsequently documented in writing and delivered to the Receiving Party within thirty days of disclosure) by or on behalf of the Disclosing Party to the Receiving Party through the Receiving Party’s directors, officers, employees, representatives, or agents (collectively referred to as “Representatives”), as well as any copies thereof; and the fact that discussions are taking place between the Parties.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, the parties acknowledge that Confidential Information does not include any information that:

  • is or becomes publicly accessible without violating this Agreement;
  • was already in the possession of the Receiving Party and was not obtained directly or indirectly from the Disclosing Party, as demonstrated by written records;
  • is lawfully received by a Party from a third party without any confidentiality obligations; and
  • is required to be disclosed by law.

Marketing and Development Information - This encompasses the Disclosing Party's plans related to marketing strategies or business growth, including costing, policies, quotations, forecasts, and strategic initiatives.

Business Operations Information - This pertains to details about the business operations of the Disclosing Party, such as workforce numbers, financial activities, and information regarding vendors, providers, and partners not disclosed to the public.

Product Information - This includes specifications for products created by the Disclosing Party, as well as products resulting from or associated with projects undertaken for the Disclosing Party or its clients, or details of products in the research and development phase.

Manufacturing and Production Processes - This refers to identified processes and systematic methods used to create product outputs, such as manufacturing or production. It includes, but is not limited to, formulas, technical procedures, methodologies, specifications, devices, equipment, designs, models, or software files utilized in manufacturing. This may also refer to Proprietary Information.

Service Information - This covers information about services offered by the Disclosing Party, such as manpower scheduling, training, and maintenance.

Intellectual Property - This includes creations of the mind, such as inventions, designs, symbols, names, and images developed for commerce. Examples include logos, computer code and algorithms (both human-readable and machine-readable), reports, technical designs, database structures, charts, and document design specifications, as well as music subject to copyright protection.

Technology - This pertains to technical and scientific information and materials created by the Disclosing Party that have not been publicly disclosed. It includes the use of any machine, appliance, components, and documented scientific processes.

Accounting Information - This involves financial reports, worksheets, balance sheets, undisclosed assets and liabilities, inventories, payroll, and any other financial-related information not disclosed or shared without the Disclosing Party's consent.

Confidential Information may also include any information provided by a third party to the Disclosing Party under a non-disclosure agreement, which the Receiving Party may acquire accidentally, incidentally, or otherwise, whether directly or indirectly.

II. Obligations.

In consideration of the disclosure and release of Confidential Information by or on behalf of the Disclosing Party to the Receiving Party, the Receiving Party agrees to maintain the strictest confidentiality regarding all such Confidential Information as defined in this Non-Disclosure Agreement.

The Receiving Party commits to using the Confidential Information exclusively for the purpose of {{purposeOfTheWork}}.

The Receiving Party shall take all necessary steps and measures to reduce the risk of disclosure, dissemination, or unauthorized use of the Confidential Information. This includes ensuring that only Representatives whose responsibilities require access to the Confidential Information are granted such access on a "need-to-know" basis. Before sharing any Confidential Information with these Representatives, the Receiving Party must obtain a written acknowledgment from them, affirming their agreement to adhere to all restrictive covenants and confidentiality obligations outlined in this Agreement. The Receiving Party remains accountable for any violations of this Agreement by its Representatives and must take all reasonable measures (including but not limited to legal action) to prevent such Representatives from engaging in unauthorized disclosure or use of the Confidential Information.

The Receiving Party shall ensure that the Confidential Information is not copied or reproduced in any form whatsoever by itself, its Representatives, or any third parties without the explicit written consent of the Disclosing Party. The Receiving Party acknowledges and agrees that the ownership and copyright of the Confidential Information disclosed to it are vested in the Disclosing Party.

The Receiving Party shall further ensure the security and control of any Confidential Information, whether in documentary or other tangible or intangible forms. This includes physically restricting access to such Confidential Information to secure areas within the Receiving Party's premises and storing it in a manner that prevents unauthorized access.

The Receiving Party agrees to promptly return to the Disclosing Party all Confidential Information upon the Disclosing Party's request at any time.

The Receiving Party shall not, nor shall it permit any of its Representatives to, publish any press releases, make announcements, or issue any denials or confirmations in any medium regarding any information covered by this Agreement, without the explicit written consent of the Disclosing Party.

At all times, it is understood that no liability for any breaches by the Company and/or its Representatives shall be attributed to the shareholders of the Company or any of its affiliated, related, associated, or subsidiary group companies, or their shareholders, in any manner whatsoever.

III. Exclusions From Confidential Information

The Receiving Party shall not require the Disclosing Party's consent to share, disclose, or copy the Confidential Information in the following scenarios:

  1. The Confidential Information is already publicly available at the time of disclosure;
  2. The Receiving Party was already aware of the information prior to its disclosure;
  3. The Receiving Party has lawfully obtained the Confidential Information from a third party not under any obligation or agreement with the Disclosing Party;
  4. The Confidential Information has been independently developed by the Receiving Party without reliance on the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information.

IV. Disclosure Due to Court Order/Governmental Action

If the Receiving Party or any of its Representatives is compelled to disclose any Confidential Information by court order or governmental directive, the Receiving Party shall immediately provide written notice to the Disclosing Party. This notice allows the Disclosing Party the opportunity to object to the disclosure and/or seek a protective order or other remedy. If the Disclosing Party cannot successfully object or obtain a remedy, the Receiving Party or its Representative(s) shall disclose only the Confidential Information required by the court order or directive and will make every effort to ensure confidential treatment of the disclosed information.

V. Non-Compete

Both parties acknowledge the importance of their respective relationships, including knowledge of their clients, partners, channels, programs, initiatives, and subsidiaries. The Receiving Party agrees not to bypass or undermine this relationship directly or indirectly with any third party without the Disclosing Party's written consent.

Furthermore, the parties agree not to engage in direct or indirect competition with the other party’s clients, affiliates, or associated work engagements without prior written approval.

VI. Reporting Unauthorized Disclosure, Misappropriation, or Misuse of Confidential Information

The Receiving Party shall immediately notify the Disclosing Party of any unauthorized disclosure, misappropriation, or misuse of Confidential Information as soon as they become aware of such incidents.

VII. Term of the Agreement

For a period of five (5) years following the termination of this Agreement, both parties shall treat all information as confidential and take reasonable measures to prevent unauthorized disclosure. The parties shall ensure their employees, agents, and assistants understand and comply with the terms of this Agreement to uphold confidentiality.

Upon the termination or completion of the Agreement, the Receiving Party shall promptly return or destroy all materials and documents containing Confidential Information, including summaries, copies, and excerpts stored in any format. The destruction must be verified in writing.

VIII. Return of Confidential Information

Upon the termination of this Agreement or at the request of the Disclosing Party, all Confidential Information disclosed under this Agreement shall be returned. Physical records, hardcopy materials, and other tangible forms of Confidential Information shall be delivered to the Disclosing Party. Digital records must be deleted with no copies retained by the Receiving Party.

If delivery is not feasible, the parties may agree to destroy the Confidential Information. Such destruction must be certified in writing and witnessed by an authorized representative of the Disclosing Party or a duly authorized officer of the Receiving Party.

IX. Ownership

This Non-Disclosure Agreement is non-transferable and requires the written consent of both parties for any transfer.

Each party retains exclusive ownership of its own Confidential Information, except as stated in the Exclusions from Confidential Information clause. No rights to the other party's Confidential Information, by license or otherwise, shall be granted without explicit consent. Any recommendations or contributions made by the Receiving Party and incorporated into the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information shall be considered part of the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information.

X. Rights Cumulative/Entirety/Variation/Severability

The rights and remedies of each Party outlined herein are cumulative and not exclusive of any rights or remedies granted by law to that Party.

This Agreement represents the entire agreement between the Parties and overrides all previous agreements related to its subject matter.

No modification of this Agreement will be valid unless it is documented in writing and signed by the Parties (or their authorized representatives).

If any provision of this Agreement (or a portion of any provision) is determined by a court or other competent authority to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable, that provision or portion thereof shall, to the extent necessary, be considered as not forming part of this Agreement and shall be severed accordingly. The validity and enforceability of the remaining provisions will not be affected.

XI. Assignment

Neither Party may assign or delegate any of its rights or transfer any of its obligations under this Agreement without obtaining the prior written consent of the other Party.

XII. General

All amendments or additions to this Agreement must be documented in writing and signed by both Parties. The effective date of this Agreement shall coincide with its execution date.

XIII. Warranties

The Disclosing Party provides no warranties or representations to the Receiving Party regarding the accuracy, completeness, or performance of the Confidential Information. No Party shall be held liable for the use of the Confidential Information.

XIV. Injunctive Relief

The Parties agree that in the event of a breach resulting from careless handling of Confidential Information, the aggrieved Party shall have the right to seek injunctive relief to prevent further damage or harm, which could lead to irreparable consequences.

XV. Counterparts

The Parties may sign this Agreement in multiple counterparts, each of which will be considered an original. Together, they shall constitute one and the same document.

XVI. Entire Agreement

This Agreement is recognized as the complete understanding between the Parties and supersedes any prior discussions or agreements regarding its subject matter. Any amendments, modifications, or alterations to this Agreement require mutual consent and must be signed by both Parties.

XVII. Separability Clause

If any provision of this Agreement is declared invalid by a competent court, such invalidity will apply solely to that specific provision. The remaining provisions will remain in full force and effect.

XVIII. Governing Laws

This Agreement shall be interpreted and enforced under the laws of the United States, excluding other state laws and without regard to conflicts of laws principles.

Any disputes arising from this Agreement shall be brought before the courts of the United States.

Each Party consents to the jurisdiction of these courts and waives any objections regarding jurisdiction, venue, or the convenience of the forum.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement on the date specified.

Receiving Party

{{receivingPartyName}}

Date: {{receivingPartyDate}}

**signature_1**/

Disclosing Party

{{disclosingPartyName}}

Date: {{disclosingPartyDate}}

**signature_2**/
reconstructed_Supply Agreement.html:
Supply Agreement

I. Agreement Parties

This Supply Agreement (the "Agreement") is executed by and between {{company.name}} with registered office at {{company.street}}, {{company.city}}, {{company.state}} {{company.postalCode}}, {{company.country}} (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and {{supplier.name}} with registered office at {{supplier.street}}, {{supplier.city}}, {{supplier.state}} {{supplier.postalCode}}, {{supplier.country}} (hereinafter referred to as the "Supplier") on {{supplier.date}}.

CONSIDERING that the Supplier operates in the business of providing specific goods as outlined below;
CONSIDERING that the Company seeks to purchase specific goods from the Supplier;
NOW, THEREFORE, in exchange for the mutual promises and obligations detailed herein, the Company and the Supplier (each a "Party" and together, the "Parties") hereby agree as follows:

II. Supply of Goods

The Supplier agrees to provide the following items (hereinafter referred to as the "Products"):

Product Description Price
{{products[0].name}} {{products[0].description}} {{products[0].price}}
{{products[1].name}} {{products[1].description}} {{products[1].price}}
{{products[2].name}} {{products[2].description}} {{products[2].price}}
{{products[3].name}} {{products[3].description}} {{products[3].price}}

III. Duration and Termination

This agreement is established for an indefinite duration on a per-order basis. Product delivery must be completed within {{deliveryDays}} days of order placement by the Company.

Either Party may terminate this Agreement without penalty by providing {{terminationNoticeDays}} days' advance notice.

Should any Party fail to meet their obligations under this Agreement and not address the breach within {{remedyPeriodDays}} business days of receiving written notification, the Agreement may be terminated immediately without compensation.

IV. Ordering, Pricing and Payment Terms

All transactions require a written invoice. Orders must be submitted in writing with detailed product specifications and quantities.

Listed prices include VAT and applicable taxes. Each order is invoiced separately. Prices remain fixed for one year from the Agreement's effective date. The Supplier must submit updated pricing after one year, or existing prices continue.

Payment is due within {{paymentTermDays}} days of invoice receipt. Late payments incur a {{interestRate}}% daily interest charge.

V. Transportation Insurance

Risk transfers to the Company upon delivery. The Supplier must maintain appropriate shipping insurance. The Supplier bears responsibility for uninsured shipping losses or damages.

VI. Product Guarantee

Products must meet specified technical and quality standards and be defect-free. Defective items not damaged by the Company must be replaced or repaired within {{warrantyPeriod}} at no cost, or the Company will be reimbursed.

VII. Force Majeure

The Supplier is exempt from liability for delays due to force majeure events including earthquakes, floods, war, or severe weather preventing delivery. The Supplier must promptly notify the Company in writing of such incidents.

VIII. Additional Terms

SEVERABILITY: Each provision stands independently. If any provision is deemed invalid, remaining provisions retain their validity.

MODIFICATIONS: Changes require written documentation signed by authorized representatives of both Parties.

ASSIGNMENT: Rights and obligations cannot be transferred without written consent from the other Party.

NON-WAIVER: Failure to enforce any provision does not constitute waiver of rights.

GOVERNING LAW: This Agreement is governed by the laws of {{governingState}}.

The Parties confirm their agreement to these terms on the date specified above.

The Supplier:

Signature: {{supplierSignature.signature}}
Name: {{supplierSignature.firstName}} {{supplierSignature.lastName}}
Date: {{supplierSignature.date}} 		The Company:

Signature: {{companySignature.signature}}
Name: {{companySignature.firstName}} {{companySignature.lastName}}
Date: {{companySignature.date}}

RELEASE OF LIABILITY

(a) Party Releasing (the "Releasor")
{{releasor.firstName}} {{releasor.lastName}}
{{releasor.streetAddress}}
{{releasor.city}}, {{releasor.state}} {{releasor.postalCode}}
{{releasor.country}} 		(b) Party Being Released (the "Releasee")
{{releasee.firstName}} {{releasee.lastName}}
{{releasee.streetAddress}}
{{releasee.city}}, {{releasee.state}} {{releasee.postalCode}}
{{releasee.country}}

FOR VALUABLE CONSIDERATION, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the parties agree to the following terms and conditions:

  1. The Releasor, including their affiliates, successors, officers, employees, representatives, partners, agents, and anyone claiming through them, hereby fully releases and discharges the Releasee from any and all claims, liabilities, damages, disputes, obligations, or causes of action, whether known or unknown, arising from the termination of contractual relationships between the parties ("Claims").
  2. As consideration for this release, the Releasee agrees to provide, and the Releasor accepts, a payment of {{amount}} as full settlement and satisfaction of any existing or potential claims.
  3. The Releasor confirms that this release is given with the express intention of eliminating certain obligations and permanently binding the Releasor's assignees, heirs, spouse, executors, legal representatives, and administrators.
  4. This Release shall not be interpreted as an admission of fault or wrongdoing by the Releasee, nor shall it imply any liability or responsibility for any purpose.
  5. This document represents the complete agreement between the parties and supersedes all previous oral or written agreements regarding the subject matter herein.
  6. If any provision of this Release is deemed invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, only that specific provision shall be affected, leaving all other provisions intact.
  7. Any modifications to this Release must be made in writing and signed by both parties.
  8. This Release represents a full and final settlement of all claims, losses, and damages related to the aforementioned dispute, with both parties acknowledging their complete understanding of all terms.
  9. This Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted according to the laws of the State of {{stateName}}.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement on {{witnessDate}}.

Room Rental Agreement Template.html:
Residential Room Rental Agreement

This Residential Room Rental Agreement (referred to as "Agreement") is entered into between {{houseowner.firstName}} {{houseowner.lastName}} (the "Property Owner") and {{renter.firstName}} {{renter.lastName}} (the "Tenant"), concerning the rental of a room at the following location:

Street Address: {{address.streetAddress}}
Additional Address Line: {{address.streetAddressLine2}}
City: {{address.city}}
State/Province: {{address.stateProvince}}
Postal/Zip Code: {{address.postalCode}}
Country: {{address.country}}

1. Duration of Agreement

The rental period begins on {{terms.startDate}} and continues on a month-to-month basis. Either party may terminate this agreement by providing {{terms.noticePeriod}} days written notice.

2. Financial Terms

Monthly rent is set at {{terms.rent}}, payable via {{terms.paymentMethod}} to the Property Owner by the {{terms.paymentDay}} of each month.

3. Agreement Termination

Standard termination requires {{terms.noticePeriod}} days notice. In cases of non-payment, the Property Owner may initiate eviction with 3 days notice after providing payment reminder and grace period.

4. House Guidelines

  • Common areas must be maintained clean and orderly
  • Kitchen use must respect other residents' belongings and schedules
  • Internet usage must comply with legal requirements
  • Noise levels must be considerate of others
  • Laundry facilities require advance scheduling
  • Damage responsibility lies with the causing party

5. Utility Cost Distribution

Gas/Electricity: {{utilities.gasElectricity}}%
Water Services: {{utilities.water}}%
Waste Management: {{utilities.garbage}}%
Internet Service: {{utilities.internet}}%
Television Services: {{utilities.cableTV}}%
Additional Services: {{utilities.otherLiability}}

6. Room Inventory and Security Deposit

Provided Fixtures:

  • {{fixtures.list[0]}}
  • {{fixtures.list[1]}}
  • {{fixtures.list[2]}}
  • {{fixtures.list[3]}}
  • {{fixtures.list[4]}}

A security deposit of {{fixtures.depositAmount}} is required. This will be returned within 10 days of move-out, less any documented damages.

7. Additional Provisions

  • This document represents the complete agreement between parties
  • Invalid clauses do not affect remaining terms
  • Changes require written consent from all parties
  • Rights transfer requires prior written approval

This agreement falls under {{governingLaw.state}} state law.

Subscription Agreement Template.html:
Subscription Agreement

This Subscription Agreement (referred to as the "Agreement") is executed on {{date}}, between:

The "Company"
{{company.name}}
{{company.streetAddress}}
{{company.streetAddressLine2}}
{{company.city}}, {{company.state}} {{company.postalCode}}
{{company.country}}
Email: {{company.email}}
Phone: {{company.phoneNumber}} 		The "Investor"
{{investor.name}}
{{investor.streetAddress}}
{{investor.streetAddressLine2}}
{{investor.city}}, {{investor.state}} {{investor.postalCode}}
{{investor.country}}
Email: {{investor.email}}
Phone: {{investor.phoneNumber}}

The Company and the Investor will be jointly referred to as the "Parties" and individually as a "Party".

BACKGROUND:

The Company seeks to raise capital through a share offering to the Investor;

The Investor wishes to participate in this offering under the terms specified herein;

Terms and Conditions

1. Share Subscription

The Investor agrees to subscribe for {{subscription.numberOfShares}} shares (the "Subscription Shares") at a total purchase price of {{subscription.purchasePrice}} (the "Subscription Amount").

Payment shall be completed within {{subscription.paymentPeriod}} days of execution via wire transfer or other approved payment methods.

The Company shall deliver the shares within {{subscription.deliveryPeriod}} days of receiving payment, either electronically or via physical certificates.

2. Representations and Warranties

2.1 Company Representations

The Company represents and warrants that:

  • It possesses all necessary corporate authority and power to execute and fulfill this Agreement;
  • All financial records provided to the Investor, including audited statements covering the relevant fiscal periods, are accurate, complete, and prepared according to standard accounting practices;
  • It has the organizational capacity and resources to fulfill all obligations outlined herein.

2.2 Investor Acknowledgments

The Investor acknowledges and confirms that:

  • They have received and thoroughly examined the Company's confidential memorandum, including the Operating Agreement;
  • They possess sufficient financial and business expertise to assess both the potential benefits and risks associated with this investment opportunity;
  • They have been granted adequate opportunities to seek clarification and additional information regarding the investment terms.

2.3 Investor Indemnification

The Investor hereby commits to protect and indemnify:

  • The Company, its leadership team, staff members, representatives, and affiliated entities;
  • Against any financial losses, legal obligations, or regulatory penalties;
  • Resulting from any violation or inaccuracy in the Investor's representations within this Agreement;
  • Including but not limited to costs of legal proceedings, settlements, and associated expenses.

2.4 Duration and Scope

These representations and warranties shall:

  • Remain valid throughout the duration of this Agreement;
  • Survive the completion of the share transfer;
  • Apply to all subsequent transactions between the Parties related to this investment.

3. Transaction Closing

Unless otherwise specified in writing by mutual agreement of the Parties, the finalization of this transaction (the "Closing") shall be conducted through digital means on {{closing.date}}.

Deliverables at Closing
Company Obligations:
• Executed Agreement
• Share certificates (digital or physical)
• Supporting documentation as required
• Additional materials upon reasonable request
Investor Obligations:
• Signed Agreement
• Payment confirmation
• Verification of fund transfer
• Supplementary documents as requested

4. Legal Framework

Governing Jurisdiction: This Agreement operates under the laws of {{legal.stateCountry}}.

Dispute Resolution: All legal proceedings shall be conducted exclusively in {{legal.jurisdiction}}. Both Parties hereby acknowledge and accept this venue's exclusive jurisdiction.

5. General Provisions

Provision Description
Succession Rights Benefits and obligations extend to successors and approved assignees. Transfers require written approval, except for corporate restructuring events.
Completeness This document supersedes all previous communications and represents the complete understanding between Parties regarding the subject matter.
Modification Protocol Changes require:
  • Written documentation
  • Explicit authorization
  • Dual-party execution
Severability Invalid provisions shall be:
  • Adjusted for compliance
  • Limited in scope to maintain validity
  • Modified without affecting other terms
Execution Format
  • Multiple counterparts permitted
  • Digital signatures equal to physical signatures
  • Each copy considered original
  • All copies form single agreement
The Company

Supply Agreement.html:
Supply Agreement

I. Agreement Parties

This Supply Agreement (the "Agreement") is executed by and between {{company.name}} with registered office at {{company.street}}, {{company.city}}, {{company.state}} {{company.postalCode}}, {{company.country}} (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") and {{supplier.name}} with registered office at {{supplier.street}}, {{supplier.city}}, {{supplier.state}} {{supplier.postalCode}}, {{supplier.country}} (hereinafter referred to as the "Supplier") on {{supplier.date}}.

CONSIDERING that the Supplier operates in the business of providing specific goods as outlined below;
CONSIDERING that the Company seeks to purchase specific goods from the Supplier;
NOW, THEREFORE, in exchange for the mutual promises and obligations detailed herein, the Company and the Supplier (each a "Party" and together, the "Parties") hereby agree as follows:

III. Duration and Termination

This agreement is established for an indefinite duration on a per-order basis. Product delivery must be completed within {{deliveryDays}} days of order placement by the Company.

Either Party may terminate this Agreement without penalty by providing {{terminationNoticeDays}} days' advance notice.

Should any Party fail to meet their obligations under this Agreement and not address the breach within {{remedyPeriodDays}} business days of receiving written notification, the Agreement may be terminated immediately without compensation.

IV. Ordering, Pricing and Payment Terms

All transactions require a written invoice. Orders must be submitted in writing with detailed product specifications and quantities.

Listed prices include VAT and applicable taxes. Each order is invoiced separately. Prices remain fixed for one year from the Agreement's effective date. The Supplier must submit updated pricing after one year, or existing prices continue.

Payment is due within {{paymentTermDays}} days of invoice receipt. Late payments incur a {{interestRate}}% daily interest charge.

V. Transportation Insurance

Risk transfers to the Company upon delivery. The Supplier must maintain appropriate shipping insurance. The Supplier bears responsibility for uninsured shipping losses or damages.

VI. Product Guarantee

Products must meet specified technical and quality standards and be defect-free. Defective items not damaged by the Company must be replaced or repaired within {{warrantyPeriod}} at no cost, or the Company will be reimbursed.

VII. Force Majeure

The Supplier is exempt from liability for delays due to force majeure events including earthquakes, floods, war, or severe weather preventing delivery. The Supplier must promptly notify the Company in writing of such incidents.

VIII. Additional Terms

SEVERABILITY: Each provision stands independently. If any provision is deemed invalid, remaining provisions retain their validity.

MODIFICATIONS: Changes require written documentation signed by authorized representatives of both Parties.

ASSIGNMENT: Rights and obligations cannot be transferred without written consent from the other Party.

NON-WAIVER: Failure to enforce any provision does not constitute waiver of rights.

GOVERNING LAW: This Agreement is governed by the laws of {{governingState}}.

The Parties confirm their agreement to these terms on the date specified above.
